intro: Tithymalus pseudosikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky areas at high altitudes. It features finely divided leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
